briefTitle: A 13-Week, Randomized, Double-Blind, Multicenter, Placebo-Controlled Study Of Pregabalin For Postherpetic Neuralgia

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) of pain is higher than 40 mm.
* Pain is sustained for more than 3 months after healing of herpes zoster skin rash.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Malignancy within the past 2 years.
* Patients who have undergone neurolytic or neurosurgical therapy for postherpetic neuralgia.
* Creatinine clearance \</= 30 mL/min (estimated from serum creatinine, body weight, age, and sex using the Cockcroft and Gault equation, by omitting any decimal fractions).
* Patients having other severe pain which may impair the self assessment of the pain due to postherpetic neuralgia.
* Skin conditions in the affected dermatome that could alter sensation.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Pain Scores at Endpoint
outcomeMeasures.description: Endpoint mean pain score is defined as the mean of the last 7 daily pain diary rating while taking the study medication, up to and including day after last dose. Scores range from 0-10 (11 points ordinal) with higher scores indicating increased pain.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Pain Score at Endpoint by Groups of Subjects With Expected Similar Plasma Concentrations
outcomeMeasures.description: Endpoint mean pain score is defined as the mean of the last 7 daily pain diary rating while taking the study medication, up to and including day after last dose. Scores range from 0-10 (11 points ordinal) with higher scores indicating increased pain.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Responders
outcomeMeasures.description: A responder is defined as a subject with a 50% reduction in weekly mean pain score from baseline to endpoint.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Pain Scores at Week 1
outcomeMeasures.description: Weekly mean pain score is defined as the mean of the last 7 daily diary pain ratings. Scores range from 0-10 (11 points ordinal)with higher scores indicating increased pain.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Pain Scores at Week 2
outcomeMeasures.description: Weekly mean pain score is defined as the mean of the last 7 daily diary pain ratings. Scores range from 0-10 (11 points ordinal)with higher scores indicating increased pain.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Pain Scores at Week 3
outcomeMeasures.description: Weekly mean pain score is defined as the mean of the last 7 daily diary pain ratings. Scores range from 0-10 (11 points ordinal)with higher scores indicating increased pain.

outcomeMeasures.title: Endpoint Sensory Scores of the Short-Form McGill Pain Questionnaire
outcomeMeasures.description: Sensory score range from 0-33. Higher scores indicate more severe pain.

outcomeMeasures.title: Endpoint Affective Scores of the Short-Form McGill Pain Questionnaire
outcomeMeasures.description: Affective score range from 0-12. Higher scores indicate more severe pain.

outcomeMeasures.title: Endpoint Total Scores of the Short-Form McGill Pain Questionnaire
outcomeMeasures.description: Total score range from 0-45. Higher scores indicate more severe pain.

outcomeMeasures.title: Endpoint Visual Analogue Scale Scores of the Short-Form McGill Pain Questionnaire
outcomeMeasures.description: Visual Analogue Scale Score range from 0-100mm. Higher scores indicate more severe pain.

outcomeMeasures.title: Endpoint Present Pain Intensity Scores of the Short-Form McGill Pain Questionnaire
outcomeMeasures.description: Present pain intensity score range from 0-5. Higher scores indicate more severe pain.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Sleep Interference Scores at Endpoint
outcomeMeasures.description: Scores range from 0-10. Higher scores indicate more severe interference with sleep.

outcomeMeasures.title: Endpoint Medical Outcomes Study Sleep Scale Scores:Sleep Disturbance
outcomeMeasures.description: Score range for sleep disturbance is 0-100.Higher scores indicate more of the attribute.

outcomeMeasures.title: Endpoint Medical Outcomes Study Sleep Scale Scores:Snoring
outcomeMeasures.description: Score range for snoring is 0-100.Higher scores indicate more of the attribute.

outcomeMeasures.title: Endpoint Medical Outcomes Study Sleep Scale Scores:Awaken Short of Breath or With Headache
outcomeMeasures.description: Score range for awaken short of breath or with headache is 0-100. Higher scores indicate more of the attribute.

outcomeMeasures.title: Endpoint Medical Outcomes Study Sleep Scale Scores:Quantity of Sleep
outcomeMeasures.description: Sleep Quantity subscale is scored from 0-24 indicating the number of hours of sleep. Higher scores indicate more of the attribute named in the subscale.

outcomeMeasures.title: Endpoint Medical Outcomes Study Sleep Scale Scores:Sleep Adequacy
outcomeMeasures.description: Score range for sleep adequacy is 0-100. Higher scores indicate more of the attribute.

outcomeMeasures.title: Endpoint Medical Outcomes Study Sleep Scale Scores:Somnolence
outcomeMeasures.description: Score range for Somnolence is 0-100. Higher scores indicate more of the attribute.

outcomeMeasures.title: Endpoint Medical Outcomes Study Sleep Scale Scores:Overall Sleep Problem Index
outcomeMeasures.description: Score range for overall sleep problem index is 0-100. Higher scores indicate more of the attribute.

outcomeMeasures.title: Endpoint Medical Outcomes Study Sleep Scale: Number of Participants With Optimal Sleep
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of participants who reported Optimal Sleep

outcomeMeasures.title: Endpoint Patient Global Impression Change
outcomeMeasures.description: Patient Global Impression Change is scaled from 1 to 7. 1=very much improved, 7=very much worse.

outcomeMeasures.title: Endpoint Clinical Global Impression Change
outcomeMeasures.description: Clinical Global Impression Change is scaled from 1 to 7. 1=very much improved, 7=very much worse.

outcomeMeasures.title: Endpoint Short-Form 36-Item Health Survey Scores: Physical Functioning
outcomeMeasures.description: Short-Form 36-Item Health Survey is scored from 0-100 with higher scores reflecting better patient status.

outcomeMeasures.description: Short-Form 36-Item Health Survey is scored from 0-100 with higher scores reflecting better patient status.

outcomeMeasures.description: Short-Form 36-Item Health Survey is scored from 0-100 with higher scores reflecting better patient status.

outcomeMeasures.description: Short-Form 36-Item Health Survey is scored from 0-100 with higher scores reflecting better patient status.

outcomeMeasures.description: Short-Form 36-Item Health Survey is scored from 0-100 with higher scores reflecting better patient status.

outcomeMeasures.description: Participants not reporting hyperalgesia.
